title: Ticket #5822: Fix linux distro detection
description:
The build code to detect the linux distro breaks with recent Red Hat-based distros. It assumes that /etc/issue contains the distro's name, which isn't always true. In RHEL 7 and recent Fedoras, /etc/issue contains "\S" instead of the actual name. On these systems, /etc/redhat-release can be used instead.

There's a larger issue that it's not uncommon for an admin to change /etc/issue to contain a customized login greeting. There's no good single place to find a distro's name and major version. The following are possibilities that work on different subsets of the distros we support:

  • /etc/redhat-release rhel6 (and clones), rhel7 (and clones), fedora23
  • /etc/debian_version debian7, debian8, ubuntu12, ubunut14
  • /etc/system-release rhel7 (and clones), fedora23
  • /etc/os-release rhel7 (and clones), fedora23, debian7, debian8, ubuntu12, ubuntu14
